intro: Erysimum japonicum, commonly known as Japanese wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan and parts of Asia. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its flowers are arranged in racemes and have four petals, making it a striking addition to gardens. Erysimum japonicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun.
